name: HatshepsutTalk
_source: s;Hatshepsut;Our rear is clear, Simon.{w} Juliet and I have seen no signs of pursuers.
s;Simon;I want you to know that we aren't keeping you here.
s;Simon;That's probably true.{w} But I didn't mean for you to be endangered.
s;Hatshepsut;In some ways, you are as naive as when we spoke in Port Hull.|I was joining with a blessed. Of course I am in danger.
s;Simon;Still. I thought our most dangerous days were behind us.
s;Hatshepsut;Mine certainly are.{w} Simon, do you recall what I said in the port?
s;Simon;That there is always a way out?
s;Hatshepsut;There still is.{w} Book passage on a merchant's vessel.|Start a new life.
s;Simon;I... would like to.{w} But, at the very least, I have to deal with Morrissey first.
